r

Set Lead

The Set Lead is responsible to succesfully carry out the whole set including objectives and key results. The lead is responsible for the cross company communication and administrational parts of the OKR method. It includes setting up the meetings, like the 1 on 1's, leadership meetings and OKR workshop.

Besides the own responsibilities of the assigned set, the lead needs to ensure the support of the organizational unit to other departments where required. It also includes adding one objective to reach the goal of another department.

Set Contributor

The set contributors are the employees participating in reaching the objectives of this set. It includes every involved people of the corresponding department that actively works on one of the key results.

A set contributor's responsiblities are updating the progress, work on the assigned key results and tasks, take part in the meetings and add possible topics in the workshop for future objectives or key results.

r

 Off track  Outdated
m{"de":"Key Results Donut Chart","en":"Key Results Donut Chart"}

r

Motivation

  • Context to Strategy
  • Status Quo
  • What is the problem to be solved?
  • Define Urgency, Dimension and Impact

Deep Insights

  • Sharpen the challenge
  • Talk about dependencies

Conclusion

  • What is the intendend target situation?
  • Risk of failure

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.solution.okr.confidenceLevel
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp:
{"de":"0.0: It is already certain you will not be able to successfully complete the KR. Nothing will help you, no more resources, no change of actions.
0.1 / 0.2: There is only a slight chance of making the 70%. We really need to crack down on the KR to get to any higher chances of success.
0.3: There is a high chance of failure already. We must put in more resources / devise an additional action plan to ensure that we get back on track.
0.4: Progress is happening but slower than anticipated. Our actions did clearly miss the mark of their impact and we start thinking about alternatives / additional measures that could be employed.
0.5: The KR has not yet been worked on or we still cannot predict in any way what our outcome might be.
0.6: We are making progress but slowly, could be a little faster or our actions had impact but not yet to that extent as we expected them to have.
0.7: We are on track, making good progress. There is quite some time with potential uncertainty left but we should be able to cover for things.
0.8 / 0.9: We are perfectly on schedule, everything is working out as planned, there is not much left that could go wrong at all - if nothing unforeseeable happens we should hit the mark easily.
1.0: The KR is already fulfilled to at least 70% and whatever will happen will not change the outcome.","en":"0.0: It is already certain you will not be able to successfully complete the KR. Nothing will help you, no more resources, no change of actions.
0.1 / 0.2: There is only a slight chance of making the 70%. We really need to crack down on the KR to get to any higher chances of success.
0.3: There is a high chance of failure already. We must put in more resources / devise an additional action plan to ensure that we get back on track.
0.4: Progress is happening but slower than anticipated. Our actions did clearly miss the mark of their impact and we start thinking about alternatives / additional measures that could be employed.
0.5: The KR has not yet been worked on or we still cannot predict in any way what our outcome might be.
0.6: We are making progress but slowly, could be a little faster or our actions had impact but not yet to that extent as we expected them to have.
0.7: We are on track, making good progress. There is quite some time with potential uncertainty left but we should be able to cover for things.
0.8 / 0.9: We are perfectly on schedule, everything is working out as planned, there is not much left that could go wrong at all - if nothing unforeseeable happens we should hit the mark easily.
1.0: The KR is already fulfilled to at least 70% and whatever will happen will not change the outcome."}

attributeDefinition.name: default.iconName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Wählen Sie aus den folgenden Icons aus \u003ca href\u003d\u0027https://fontawesome.com/v4.7.0/icons/\u0027 target\u003d\u0027_blank\u0027\u003eFont Awesome\u003c/a\u003e und übertragen Sie den Icon-Namen mit vorangestelltem Präfix „fa-“ (z.B. als „fa-circle-o“).","en":"Choose one of the icons of \u003ca href\u003d\u0027https://fontawesome.com/v4.7.0/icons/\u0027 target\u003d\u0027_blank\u0027\u003eFont Awesome\u003c/a\u003e and enter the icon name preceded with prefix “fa-“ (e.b. “fa-circle-o”)."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.conditionAttributeName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Gleicht das in der Ereignisklasse angegebene Attribut dem angegeben Wert, so wird eine Ereignisseite dieser Ereignisklasse zugeordnet. Ist das Attribut eine Referenz, so repräsentiert der angegebene Attributwert den (internen) Namen der referenzierten Seite. Trifft keine definierte Ereignisklasse zu, oder sind keine zusätzlichen Ereignisklassen definiert, wird der Ereignistyp selbst als Ereignisklasse zugeordnet.","en":"If the attribute value of an event is equal to the event class\u0027 attribute value, the event is assigned to this event class. If the attribute is a reference, the value of \"attributeValue\" represents the (internal) name of the referred page. Only the first event class fulfilling this condition will be applied."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.conditionValue
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Gleicht das in der Ereignisklasse angegebene Attribut dem angegeben Wert, so wird eine Ereignisseite dieser Ereignisklasse zugeordnet. Ist das Attribut eine Referenz, so repräsentiert der angegebene Attributwert den (internen) Namen der referenzierten Seite. Trifft keine definierte Ereignisklasse zu, oder sind keine zusätzlichen Ereignisklassen definiert, wird der Ereignistyp selbst als Ereignisklasse zugeordnet.","en":"If the attribute value of an event is equal to the event class\u0027 attribute value, the event is assigned to this event class. If the attribute is a reference, the value of \"attributeValue\" represents the (internal) name of the referred page. Only the first event class fulfilling this condition will be applied."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.displayName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Der Anzeigename der Ereignisklasse, welcher z.B. bei der Ereignisklassenauswahl des Kalendars verwendet wird.","en":"The display name of the event class which, e.g., is used for the event class selection within the calendar widget."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.color
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Farbe der Ereignisklasse. Dieses Attribut ist optional. Wird es nicht angegeben, wird die Farbe des Ereignistyps als Farbe der Ereignisklasse verwendet.","en":"The color of the event class. This attribute is optional. If it is not defined, the color of the event type will be applied."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.order
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Die Reihenfolge der Ereignistypen, wie sie beispielsweise im Menü zur Erzeugung neuer Ereignisse im Kalendar angezeigt werden.","en":"The order of the event types which, e.g., is used for the menu within the calendar widget to create new events."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.eventTypeName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Der cplace-Typ, welcher als Ereignistyp registriert werden soll. Um das Start- und Enddatumsattribut als auch Ereignisklassenzu definieren, müssen Sie nach dessen Aktualisierung den Ereignistyp erst speichern","en":"The cplace type which has to be registered as event type. In order to specifiy the start and end date attributes as well as event classes, you have to save the event type after its value was changed."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.startDateAttributeName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Das Attribut des gewählten cPlace-Typs, welches das Startdatum des Ereignisses enthält.","en":"The attribute of the selected cplace type which holds the start date of the event."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.endDateAttributeName
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Das Attribut des gewählten cPlace-Typs, welches das Enddatum des Ereignisses enthält.","en":"The attribute of the selected cplace type which holds the end date of the event."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.color
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Standardfarbe des Ereignistyps. Diese Farbe wird angewandt, wenn entweder keine Ereignisklassen in der Konfiguration des Typs definiert ist, oder wenn für eine bestimmte Ereignisseite keine Ereignisklasse angewandet werden kann.","en":"The color of the event type. This color will be applied if either no event class is specified for this type, or if none of the defined event classes is applicable."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.displayNamePattern
attributeDefinition.localizedName: {"de":"Muster zur Erzeugung der Ereignisnamen","en":"Event name generation pattern"}
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Das hier angegegebene Muster wird verwendet um die Namen der Ereignisse im Kalender zu erzeugen. Die möglichen Attribute des Musters leiten sich vom Ereignistyp ab. Ist kein Muster angegeben, wird der Name der dem Ereignis zugrunde liegenden Seite verwendet. Möchte man diesen Namen ebenfalls im Muster verwenden, kann $name$ als Platzhalter verwendet werden.","en":"This pattern is used to generate the names of the events in the calendar. The possible attributes of the pattern will be derived from the event type. Is no pattern defined, the event name will be the name of the underlying page of the event. To use this name as part of the pattern, use $name$ as placeholder."}

attributeDefinition.name: cf.cplace.simpleCalendar.eventClasses
attributeDefinition.localizedShortHelp: {"de":"Jeder Ereignistyp kann eine beliebige Menge von Ereignisklassen definieren, welche den entsprechenden Ereignistyp noch weiter anhand bestimmter Attributwerte unterteilen können. Die Ereignisklassen werden dabei in der definierten Reihenfolge auf deren Anwendbarkeit getestet.","en":"Event classes which distinguish the events of the respective type into specific event classes based on the values of attributes. They will be tested for applicability in the defined order. If one event class is applicable, the conditions of the subsequent ones won\u0027t be tested. If none of the event classes is applicable, the event type itself will be implicitly interpreted as event class."}
